thread.title: George Washington blows out Rangeview in nonconference boys basketball
thread.title_full: George Washington blows out Rangeview in nonconference boys basketball

author: Kyle Newman
title: George Washington blows out Rangeview in nonconference boys basketball
text:
MLK weekend traffic, avalanche danger and snow could create “perfect storm” in Colorado’s high country 
Class 5A No. 2 George Washington stood tall hosting a skilled Rangeview squad Friday night, as the Patriots used a dominant first half to blow out the Raiders 81-45 in nonconference play. 
It took nearly three minutes for either team to score, but the Patriots broke open the stalemate with a 7-0 run to start the first quarter. By halftime they had a 41-14 advantage in a game in which George Washington used full-court pressure and consistent finishes at the rim to assert its dominance. MORE: BOX SCORE 
Senior Calvin Fugett Jr. led all scorers with 26 points, and George Washington got additional 18-point contributions from both junior Jon’il Fugett and senior Shaheem Speer with star senior point guard Jervay Green sidelined by injury. 
The Patriots now have racked up two impressive wins in a row following their first in-state loss to No. 1 ThunderRidge on Jan. 6, and Friday night they looked like a team capable of earning the program’s sixth state title and first since Chauncey Billups led them to the 1994 state championship.
